content: FYI: I'll be on leave from Dec 25 till Jan. 3, so expect me to be more active during the week between Xmas and NYD, including the weekends before/after ...excited to be sprinting for 1.18.0 :heart:

So, we scheduled Sprints for Dec 13th and Jan 2nd.
https://backdropcms.org/news/events/contribution-sprint-for-118

We'll be sprinting on Backdrop Core this coming Sunday. Please drop by. Beginners welcome. See blog post for video link and time zone conversions.

https://backdropcms.org/news/events/contribution-sprint-for-118

The hr we've set for the sprint tomorrow will be 10pm for me, which makes it only 2hrs before I have to start work (I work midnight to 8am Greek time, which is 9-5 Melbourne time) ...so I'll most likely start sprinting early :smile:

The hr we've set for the sprint tomorrow will be 10pm for me, which makes it only 2hrs before I have to start work (I work midnight to 8am Greek time, which is 9-5 Melbourne time) ...so I'll most likely start sprinting early :smile:

I set up a Jit.si room and put the link in event on Backdrop CMS org. Feel free to jump in the room and let folks know you are there, in case anyone wants to join you early.
I might be there early.
Thanks @StPaulTim :+1:
@Phil Ward - If you are able to drop into the sprint tomorrow, I'm sure that one of us can show you how to write a simple PR in the Github UI (for the Brotli issue).
Thanks @StPaulTim I'll see how tomorrow looks.
I've been sprinting on my own over the weekend, now want to go watch a movie with the family. See you all for the scheduled sprint in a couple of hrs.
Hello sprinters!

I'm going to be working on Backdrop for an hour, but then I have a zoom call so I won't be here when things officially kick off. I'll be back an hour later though, don't have too much fun without me :)
Zoom room! https://bit.ly/backdrop-meetings-new
I'm passively starting now, but I'm with family right now and not really able to join Zoom now.
No problem, I'm there if anyone else wants to keep me company
and If not, I have my dog so I'll be okay
she makes a good rubber duck.
I'm here :wave: ...joining in 5min.

Just chatted with @jenlampton in Zoom and we're going to switch back to the Jit.si room that I had posted in the event announcement.

https://meet.jit.si/585350955147516

Jitsi Meet
Join a WebRTC video conference powered by the Jitsi Videobridge
I'm there now.
Want to try recording/streaming from Jitsi? If only to better test how that works for future discussions about moving all meetings to open-source...?
@BWPanda - I think we'll try to record something. Although, I don't think we'll try to connect to Youtube today.
FYI - There are three of us in the conference room now, I expect a few more later.
My battery died. Where did everyone go?

Well, I'm back in the same room again. If anyone wants to join me.

Let me know if I'm in the wrong place.
We have 5 people in conference room now.

https://github.com/orgs/backdrop/teams/documentation-and-organization

Build software better, together
GitHub is where people build software. More than 50 million people use GitHub to discover, fork, and contribute to over 100 million projects.
@Joseph Flatt - It took me too long, but I finally posted that updated PR for Configurable Block Style.

I just merged WebP support (https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4509) great work @indigoxela @Herb @klonos @Laryn @Phil Ward @docwilmot and team!!

Add webp support · Issue #4509 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need A common "Opportunity" listed in Google PageSpeed insights is to "Serve images in next-gen formats." Backdrop does not currently support any next-gen for...
@StPaulTim Looks good. I will merge it soon.

@jenlampton Could you revisit https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4447 and see if you would be okay with the compromise I put in the last comment?

Provide advanced admin option to skip deleting config staging files after a config sync · Issue #4447 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need There's a long standing issue in Pantheon (and likely Platform.sh too) where the live code directory is locked. If a developer puts config into the repo it means that it...

Full HTML to RAW HTML PR is ready for review.
https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4499

[UX] Change the name of the "Full HTML" text format to "Raw HTML" · Issue #4499 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
This has been discussed elsewhere, but I can't find an issue that focuses attention on this potential fix to what I think is a serious UX bug, so I opened this issue. Description of the bug Cal...
Sorry I missed this. Family commitments here.

https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4663 could use a final code review please. I've proposed pushing @klonos' combo field suggestion to a follow-up issue so that we don't miss getting this feature in the next release.

Add setting to menu block for changing breakpoint · Issue #4663 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Status [19th Nov]: PR needs review and testing. Description of the need When you tick 'Display menu toggle button on small screens' in a menu block, it changes the menu to a menu toggle but...
@StPaulTim I requested some formatting changes.

@quicksketch I added a counter-compromise in https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4447#issuecomment-744135895 :)

Provide advanced admin option to skip deleting config staging files after a config sync · Issue #4447 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Description of the need There's a long standing issue in Pantheon (and likely Platform.sh too) where the live code directory is locked. If a developer puts config into the repo it means that it...
I likely won't be able to participate much in the 1.18.0 sprint tomorrow (my Sun morning), but I've merged a few RTBC issues lately, so hope that helps free up core committers for other tasks :smile:
Thanks @BWPanda++
bwpanda go team. (Karma: 27)
Hi folks! I think the sprint starts in about 20 minutes. I'll be joining in a few hours.
Sorry, but I'm late. Arriving now and will open room.

OK, the Jit.si room is open. https://meet.jit.si/298820773727491

It's just me right now. I expect more to join later. If you show up in video room and I am not there, I'll be back shortly.

Jitsi Meet
Join a WebRTC video conference powered by the Jitsi Videobridge
Ahh sprint today, forgot.
So what's everyone working on today?

So far, we had a first time participant (from Mexico) drop in to say hello and chat for a while.

We talked a little about the PR to add support for relationships to Layout Contexts.

And, I'm hoping to work on Telemetry a bit.
Was this a sprint to work on things for 1.18.0 before feature freeze, or just a general Backdrop sprint?
It was listed as a sprint for 1.18.0, but it's not limited to that. Anyone can work on anything. I'm trying to focus on 1.18 features, but I get easily distracted.
@docwilmot says that it's still possible to get support for relationships to layout contexts into 1.18, so that is a good issue to focus on.
I'm thinking it MIGHT still be possible to get a first draft of telemetry into 1.18, but I need to update the issue and get feedback from @quicksketch

I also need feedback from @quicksketch on https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues/4663 (really hoping to get that in to 1.18.0; got 24 hrs to do so)...

Add setting to menu block for changing breakpoint · Issue #4663 · backdrop/backdrop-issues
Status [31st Dec]: PR needs (hopefully) final code review. Description of the need When you tick 'Display menu toggle button on small screens' in a menu block, it changes the menu to a menu...
Excuse the abrupt departure.

For anyone interested, here's the list of issues slated for the 1.18.0 release: https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop-issues/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+milestone%3A1.18.0

backdrop/backdrop-issues
Issue tracker for Backdrop core. Contribute to backdrop/backdrop-issues development by creating an account on GitHub.

Is there any chance of a code review on https://github.com/backdrop/backdrop/pull/3422?

Issue #2134: Add support for "Relationships" to Layout Contexts by docwilmot · Pull Request #3422 · backdrop/backdrop
Fixes backdrop/backdrop-issues#2134
@docwilmot we did discuss this just now. @quicksketch will have a closer look, but the general feeling was that anything too "exotic" (like the "Entity from schema" thing) should be left for contrib.
Cool. I'm gonna go ahead and remove those plugins meanwhile.
